artist: Artist: Hashiguchi Goyō; Carver: Keyblock carved by Koike Masazō; Carver: Color blocks carved by Maeda Kentarō; Printer: Taguchi Kikumatsu; Producer: Posthumously produced by Hashiguchi Yasuo
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: standing woman wearing a blue floral kimono and holding an obi with flower and butterfly pattern; hanging lamp, URC; green floor
inscription: red seal: 夏装之娘 {Natsu yosōi no musume} (Girl in a Summer Kimono); 大正九年八月 {Taishō kunen hachigatsu} (August 1920)
markings: red artist\'s seal: 五葉 {Goyō}; LRC: red artist\'s seal: はしぐち {Hashiguchi}; LRC: red printer seal: 摺田口菊松 {suri Taguchi Kikumatsu}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica
text: Artwork dated to August 1920 but first posthumously printed in 1952. Goyō’s model, Nakatani Tsuru  中谷つる, is holding a richly decorated obi (sash) that she is going to wrap around her black summer kimono.
title: Girl in Summer Clothes
